definition: to circumvent the law
to twist/crooked/unjust/in vain
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])
corruption and abuse of the law (idiom); to take bribes and bend the law
see 徇私枉法[xun4 si1 wang3 fa3]
to bend the law in order to favor one's relatives or associates (idiom)

sentences.english: The crime of bending the law for self-seeding is the judicial staff malfeasance of ceremony punishment…
sentences.chinese: 徇私枉法罪是典型的司法工作人員瀆職犯罪。

sentences.english: Finally, except conduction, the omission may also constitute the crime of bending the law for selfish ends.
sentences.chinese: 再次，除作爲外，不作爲可以構成徇私枉法罪。

sentences.english: We should try to clear graft, waste and inefficiency out of government.
sentences.chinese: 我們應該盡力消除政府中的貪贓枉法。

sentences.english: It is hoped that the new laws will scotch the snake of dishonesty among members of the government.
sentences.chinese: 大家希望新法律能打擊政府人員貪贓枉法。

sentences.english: Civil law- bending judgment crime is one of the weak topics in the study of penal law theory.
sentences.chinese: 民事枉法裁判罪是刑法理論研究較爲薄弱的一個問題。

sentences.english: The crime of bending the law to serve one's personal considerations for favoritism is the judicial personnel's malfeasance.
sentences.chinese: 徇私枉法罪是防治刑事司法人員職務犯罪的重要規定。

sentences.english: The corruption, nepotism, favoritism, moneyembezzlement, all and all will fall apart.
sentences.chinese: 腐敗，裙帶關係，徇私枉法以及貪污都將土崩瓦解。

to bend the law in order to favor one's relatives or associates (idiom)

to have disregard for human life (idiom)
national law
to frame sb/to accuse falsely
to gain from corrupt dealing/to engage in graft/to feather one's nest
wrongdoing/failure to do one's duty
to be corrupt/corruption/to embezzle
with no regard for law or discipline (idiom); flouting the law and disregarding all rules/in complete disorder
(of an official) corrupt and negligent of his duty
a corrupt official
officials shield one another (idiom); a cover-up
to use one's position for personal gain (idiom)
to punish sb (for a crime)
to know the law and break it (idiom); consciously going against the rules
